intro: Ceratolimon migiurtinum, commonly known as the Eritrean thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Eritrea and Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, spiny leaves, and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing at elevations above 1,500 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
